SiteNameAddress: Land at Ottery Moor Lane, Honiton
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan for housing development, SHLAA322, formerly part of an industrial estate. Reserved matters application for a residential development of 150 dwellings with appearance, landscaping, layout and scale to be assessed (pursuant to outline consent 14/0557/MOUT)

SiteNameAddress: Land at Ottery Moor Lane, Honiton
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan for housing development, SHLAA 321, formerly part of an industrial estate. Site in 2 parts (see above)

SiteNameAddress: Land at Pankhurst Close Trading Estate, Pankhurst Close, Exmouth
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan, SHLAA317, formerly in employment use; planning permission renewed June 2019. Construction of 120 dwellings with associated access, landscaping and infrastructure works [this permission incorporates a larger area than the brownfield land in question; around 50 dwgs are planned for the brownfield land]

SiteNameAddress: Land and buildings at Winslade Park, Clyst St Mary
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan for mixed use redevelopment, W344 (application not approved). Hybrid outline application for 150 dwellings including full permission for 67 dwellings (conversion of Winslade House and stables) and 0.7ha of employment land use)

SiteNameAddress: Land and buildings at 34 Cranford Avenue, Exmouth
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Currently under construction. Demolition of existing dwelling and construction of 12 apartments

SiteNameAddress: Land North Of Acland Park, Feniton
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Application refused but allowed by appeal in 2014; currently under construction. Redevelopment of site and construction of 32 dwellings

SiteNameAddress: Land and Buildings at Former Cuttler Hammer Factory and Tumbling Weir Hotel Car Park, Ottery St Mary
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Part of a Floodzone 2; townhouses under construction and building work started on car park and the conversion of the old switchgear factory. Redevelopment of parcels of land making up the overall former Cuttler Hammer factory site and Tumbling Weir hotel car park; comprising conversion of building to 30 apartments, construction of 33 new dwellings and 29 retirement apartments

SiteNameAddress: Land and buildings at Salston Manor Hotel, Ottery St Mary
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Application withdrawn. Construction of 16 dwellings within the grounds of Salston Manor and erection of two storey and single storey extension to form 3 no new flats - WITHDRAWN
